bibl.title: Report: United Fruit Company Steamship Service--Medical Department, Report of Death, by L. O. Woodward, Charles F. Elchinger, and L. Burmeister, September 21, 1923

div1.p: This report of death lists pertinent details concerning the deceased.

div1.head: Report: United Fruit Company Steamship Service--Medical Department, Report of Death, by L. O. Woodward, Charles F. Elchinger, and L. Burmeister, September 21, 1923
div1.p:
COPY
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
STEAMSHIP SERVICE - MEDICAL DEPARTMENT
REPORT OF DEATH
PART NO. I

list.item: 1. Name of person deceased: Jas. S. Roudabush
2. Address: New York City, N. Y.
3. Passenger or member of crew: Consular passenger
4. Occupation or profession: Painter
6. Sex: Male
7. Citizenship: American
8. Race: White
9. Married, single or divorced: Single

10. Name and address of nearest relative: Brother - W. P. Roudabush,
Bloomington, N. C.
11. Duration of illness: 3 days
12. Length of time under care of Steamship's Doctor: 3 days
13. Cause of death: Malarial fever
14. Time of death: (a) Hour 8:30 P.M. (b) Day 18th (c) Month Sept. (d) Year 1923
15. Place of death: Havana, Cuba
16. Disposal of body: Public Cemetery, Havana, Cuba.
17. Was it embalmed?

div1.p:
Signature: L. O. Woodward, M. D.
Date: Sept. 21, 1923.

list.item:
1. List of Effects of Deceased:
(a) Clothing, etc.: None Whatsoever
(b) Valuables: None
(c) Documents, papers, etc.: None
NOTE: If a member of the crew, amount of wages due at time of death: None

2. Disposal of Effects: ......
Consular Passenger Jas. E. Roudabush came aboard, at Pto. Barrios,
Guatemala, with No personal effects whatsoever, otherwise than the trousers
and shirt which was worn by him when taken ashore in Havana.

div1.p:
L. Burmeister
Captain
Chas. F. Elchinger
Purser
Date: Sept. 21, 1923.
